Madrid-based newspaper AS claims Atleti will pay £41m up front for the exiled Spanish international with another £9m in potential add-ons to come at a later date.

Costa had accused Chelsea of pricing him out of a move as the Spanish club, who are under a transfer ban until January, tried to secure a cut-price £30million deal.

Atleti will be unable to register Costa until 2018, but will look to get him a six-month loan elsewhere to get him some playing time.

Costa has been training in Brazil after refusing to report to Chelsea following Antonio Conte telling him he was not needed via text.

Newcastle United expect to tie up the signing of Kenedy from Chelsea this week — but will have to wait until the end of the month to see whether the Blues will allow Michy Batshuayi to go out on loan.(Mail)

Chelsea boss Antonio Conte is planning to spend £200m Danny Drinkwater,
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, and three defenders from Southampton: Virgil van Dijk, Cedric Soares, and Ryan Bertrand.(Express)

Drinkwater, 27, is wanted by the Blues but they are a long way from Leicester’s valuation.

Chelsea have already had a bid rejected last week worth just under £20m.

But Foxes reckon Drinkwater is worth around £40m in the current market – the same valuation placed upon star playmaker Riyad Mahrez.

Paris Saint-Germain’s Krychowiak has emerged as an alternative for Antonio Conte to bolster his midfield.

The Poland international, 27, will be allowed to leave the French giants on loan as they shape their squad following Neymar’s arrival.

Chelsea could land the ex-Sevilla star for the season and ease the pressure on N’Golo Kante, Cesc Fabregas and Tiemoue Bakayoko in central midfield.(Sun)

Arsene Wenger says he expects Arsenal to sell some players before the end of the transfer window as the size of the current squad is "not manageable."

Arsenal suffered a 1-0 defeat at Stoke City on Saturday, but Wenger doesn't expect reinforcements to steady the ship.

Quite the opposite, in fact, as he expects to downsize before the window closes on Aug. 31.

"I expect to sell players first, that is all," Wenger told reporters after the game. "I expect some players to go because we have too many players and it is not manageable.
